intro: Aegiphila nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined aegiphila, is a perennial shrub native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins and clusters of tubular, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Aegiphila nervosa is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
